intro: Wahlenbergia zeyheri var. natalensis, commonly known as Natal's bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial herb with slender stems and small, narrow leaves. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
